title: 109_s3584
content: The Act titled "Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006" mandates training programs for supervisors. The Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006 mandates training programs for supervisors, including interactive instructor-based training on developing goals and objectives with employees. The training program for supervisors includes sessions on developing goals with employees, mentoring and motivating staff, managing unacceptable performance, and other supervisory duties. Additionally, there is interactive training on prohibited personnel practices and enforcement procedures, as well as a mentoring program for new supervisors by experienced ones. The training program for supervisors includes sessions on developing goals, mentoring staff, managing performance, and enforcing employee rights. New supervisors are mentored by experienced ones to transfer knowledge in communication, critical thinking, and teamwork. Supervisors must complete programs within specified timeframes and receive credit for previous training. The training program for supervisors includes sessions on developing goals, mentoring staff, managing performance, and enforcing employee rights. Credit is given for previous similar training completed. The Office of Personnel Management will prescribe regulations for agency compliance. Regulations must be in place within 180 days of enactment. Effective 180 days after enactment, the amendments apply to new supervisors and current employees in supervisor positions. Each supervisor must complete training programs within 3 years of the effective date and every 3 years thereafter. The Office of Personnel Management will establish regulations for agency compliance within 180 days of enactment. SEC. 3. MANAGEMENT COMPETENCY STANDARDS. Chapter 43 of title 5, United States Code, is amended to include new management competency standards for supervisors. The Office of Personnel Management will provide guidance to agencies on these standards, and each agency must develop performance assessment standards for supervisors based on this guidance. The Office of Personnel Management will provide guidance to agencies on new management competency standards for supervisors. Agencies must assess supervisor capacity, develop training programs, and submit progress reports annually. Technical and conforming amendments are also made to chapter 43 of title 5, United States Code. The Office of Personnel Management will provide guidance on new management competency standards for supervisors, including regulations and technical amendments to title 5, United States Code.
